Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.

Case reference: 2014004125.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1979, the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP Detachment received a report that David Voisey had gone through the ice while riding as a passenger on a snowmobile near Epinette Point, North West River, Newfoundland and Labrador. Mr. Voisey  has never been located.

Case reference: 2014005457.CaseDesc: On July 7, 2010, Roosdianajati and Didik Harijanto were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Roosdianajati and Didik were scheduled to work, but did not show up for their shifts.

Case reference: 2014002433.CaseDesc:
On April 13, 1995, Wendy Smith was last seen leaving the Fantasia strip club
formerly located on 10097 Yonge Street in Richmond Hill, Ontario. Wendy had 
her first shift there that night, and was due to return to her home in Toronto later
that night, but never arrived.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, Two six inch scars
Foreign Object: Cheek, Metal plate on the right

Case reference: 2022007575.CaseDesc: On February 24, 2022, Stacie Rasberry was reported missing from Hamilton, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Stacie was considered to be in a very vulnerable state.

Hat: Red, TOQUE, Toque with pom pom on top

Mark: Chin, Mole on the left side

Case reference: 2014004060.CaseDesc: On December 31, 1973, Conor Sheehan was seen for the last time when he left his family residence in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002857.CaseDesc: Colin Campbell was last seen March 12, 1998. Mr.Campbell was seen jumping off the Reversing Falls Bridge in Saint John, NB. His body has not been recovered.

Case reference: 2021048330.CaseDesc: On July 12, 2015, at approximately 7 :00 a.m., Dan Ingram was seen for the last time as he slipped and fell into the water near the Whirlpool State Park in Niagara Falls, New York.

Scar: Left Forearm, From wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2014002108.CaseDesc: Craig Waldum along with 7 others were on a canoeing expedition along the Nelson River. Craig was one of two guides on the expedition. On August 18, 1978, three members of the expedition were on shore guiding in a canoe. The remaining 5 members including Craig remained in the canoe. As these individuals labored to guide the canoe to shore, the rope was given some slack. This caused the bow of the canoe to turn out into the current, which in turn caused the canoe to tip. The individuals on shore were unable to hold onto the rope due to the strength of the current and the canoe was carried downstream. Craig hung onto the canoe for a couple hours then was seen letting go. He slipped under the water and did not resurface. Mr. Waldum's remains have not been recovered and foul play is not suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2016060952.CaseDesc: On October 2, 2016, Gaétan Roy was seen for the last time at his residence in Quebec City, Quebec. He left with a considerable amount of his personal effects and without saying where he was going. His credit cards were last used on October 6, 2016, in the Calgary, Alberta area. Gaétan is known to be despondent and he is familiar with western Canada and National Parks.

Mark: Left Forearm, Burn on the lower part
Right Forearm, Burn on the lower part

Case reference: 2017014429.CaseDesc: On June 7, 1982 the body of a man was recovered from the Bow River in Calgary, Alberta. The individual had multiple fingers amputated and had an unhealed break in his right arm.

Shirt: Yellow, Black, TSHIRT, Number 38 on front in black letters
Jacket: Beige, Blue, ZIPUP, Blue plaid inside
Denim, Blue, Sheepskin lining, snaps on front

Scar: Left Little Finger, On distal end of palmar side
Right Side Of Head, 3 cm long on right front parietal region
Tattoo: Left Hand, "F" between forefinger and thumb
Mark: Left Thigh, Biopsy site mid left femur
Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Forearm, Healing fracture of distal ulna
Amputation: Left Hand, Amputation through base of thumb
Left Hand, Amputation through PIP joint on the 2nd through 5th fingers
Right Hand, Amputation through PIP joint on the 2nd through 5th fingers

Case reference: 2007005499.CaseDesc: Lindsey Nicholls was 14 years old when she disappeared in 1993. She left the group home where she was living in the Comox Valley, BC at about 10:30 a.m. after having an argument with her foster mother. She was last seen walking away from the residence to visit some friends in Courtenay. She left all of her belongings and treasures in her room; she did not seem to be planning to run away.

Case reference: 2014003167.CaseDesc: Rufus Standingribbon was last seen in the month of October 1999 near Spirit River, Alberta. Mrs. Standingribbon did not notify anyone that he was going to be leaving the area as he normally did.

Case reference: 2012020172.CaseDesc: Remains of this adult male were found in a wooded area in Surrey, near Scott Road and 64th Avenue.

Case reference: 2012020010.CaseDesc: Jacek Laskowski was reported missing on May 3, 2005, from Calgary, AB.  Information suggests that he may have been last seen in the Golden, BC area.

Case reference: 2019068219.CaseDesc: On November 17, 2019, Marshal Iwaasa was last seen by his family in Lethbridge, Alberta. During this time, Marshal had told his family that he was returning to Calgary, Alberta. On November 23, his burnt vehicle was recovered at the end of Phelix Creek Forest Service Road, in a remote area near the Birkenhead Lake Provincial Park in British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003528.CaseDesc: Mrs. Huyghe was reported missing after she had not returned home. Police investigations regarding Mrs. Huyghe are ongoing and her whereabouts remain unknown.

Boots: Leather, Black, winter boot with suede fur tops
Jewelry: Metal, Gold, family ring with colored stone

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife

Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2014006454.CaseDesc: Jonathan Jay Wood was last seen in November 2013, in Abbotsford, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014001643.CaseDesc: On January 10, 1989, Diane Racicot was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. That morning, Diana left a farewell letter in the family home. She left without a change of clothes and with very little money. Diane speaks four languages.

Case reference: 2006006899.CaseDesc: Ruth Jackson is an Alzheimer's patient, who was travelling in a car with her husband, who is also an Alzheimer's patient.  At some point, Mrs. Jackson got out of their vehicle and her husband drove off. He cannot recall where he left his wife. They were last seen together in the Elm Tree Road area of Kaladar.  An extensive air and ground search was conducted with negative results. Foul play is not suspected.

Case reference: 2014005703.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1964, Harold Jackman was seen for the last time at his farm in Shillington, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Mr. Jackman wandered away from his farm.

Case reference: 2011006199.CaseDesc: Clifford Scruton, age 48, was known to frequent the downtown area of Kitchener and was of no fixed address. He would attend downtown medical centres and withdrawal management for drug and alcohol abuse. Mr. Scruton was last seen in mid-July 2003 at the Downtown Health Centre in Kitchener, Ontario.

Hair: Black, White, Straight, Short, Grey/black, messy; Beard
Teeth: Visible Missing, Irregular, broken/missing lower and upper  - decayed

Case reference: 2015060160.CaseDesc: On May 27, 1970, a male was found floating in the water at the foot of Seguins Boat House in Rockcliffe, Ottawa. He has partially balding, grey hair. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 158 lbs and his length was measured at 5'8", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. Several anterior and posterior teeth were missing in the upper and lower jaw. He had 1 cent and a pack of matches in his pocket. It is believed that he had been in the water for up to 48 hours prior to recovery.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Several anterior and posterior teeth were missing in the upper and lower jaw.

Watch: Gold, Gold band with expansion; with the inscribed initials "C.I.B."

Scar: Left Side Of Head, 1.5 x 1 cm slightly depressed scar on his left temple

Case reference: 2010003699.CaseDesc: During the evening of Friday, May 31, 1974, 7 year old Cheryl Hanson left her home on Bloomington Road for a 10 minute walk to her cousin’s house, also located on Bloomington Road. She never arrived.  No trace of Cheryl or any of her belongings has ever been found.

Other: Paper bag with white pajamas with floral design

Case reference: 2017040839.CaseDesc: Claude Lévesque was last seen on July 17, 2017, in the Mercier/Hochelaga-Maisonneuve sector of Montreal. He had an appointment with his Doctor that afternoon, yet he never showed up. He is known to be despondent.

Scar: Right Forearm, Front of arm, wrist to elbow

Case reference: 2014003208.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1996, Louie Stalthanee was last seen at approximately 4:00 p.m. on the East side of Fir Island on Black Lake in Saskatchewan. The boat he had been using was found beached on Fir Island. It is suspected that Mr. Stalthanee drowned; however he has never been located.

Case reference: 2008003399.CaseDesc: William Smith was last seen operating a large boat leaving Port Rowan, Ontario at approximately 5:30 pm on June 23, 1983. The boat was seen heading out to the north channel, which would lead into Lake Erie. The boat is described as a white, 31 foot, 1977 Bertram hardtop cruiser with a flying bridge. The hull VIN number is 3121641B and the boat had twin Mercruiser 330 hp engines.

Case reference: 2014002449.CaseDesc: On July 27, 1997, Mike Tsannie was last seen traveling by boat across Wollaston Lake, SK. Mr. Tsannie’s boat was later found unoccupied, and searches failed to locate any trace of him.

Case reference: 2014006282.CaseDesc: On November 26, 2012, a relative of Jean Marc Lavallée called the Roussillon Inter-municipal police to check on Mr. Lavallée at his residence in La Prairie, Québec, as they were worried about him. The police found that Mr. Lavallée was not at his residence, and his vehicle was not in the parking lot. The police took numerous steps to locate Mr. Lavallée, but he remains missing. He was seen for the last time on November 25, 2012.

Case reference: 2018005079.CaseDesc: Joshua Hawkins was last seen on January 28, 2018, at approximately 6pm when he left the Brockville General Hospital without being discharged.

Tattoo: Right Calf, Lion and dragon with the word Kaitlyn
Right Upper Arm , Outline of a heart
Right Leg, Skull and hand holding a flame - on the front of the leg

Case reference: 2005004799.CaseDesc: On February 17, 1991, an unidentified man was found floating in Lake Ontario, near 'Captain John's Boat Restaurant' on Queens Quay, west of Yonge Street near the Harbour Castle Hotel. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 166 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His skin was brown, perhaps suggesting a Middle Eastern, East Indian or North African ethnic affiliation. He had a wide nose and long slim fingers. His appendix was present and he was circumcised.

Hair: Black, Curly, Wavy, Hair shorter than collar; he had fine stubble on his face
Teeth: His teeth were in good condition with no restorations.

Money: $10.07 was found in bills and coin in his right front pocket
Shoes: Canvas, White, Cana Sport, running shoes; size 9 with white soles, LOT #21753
Belt: Brown, a narrow, light brown belt with a metal end
Underwear: Blue, Mr. Brief, jockey style; white waistband
Pants: Denim, Black, Levi's, size 33-34 with a button fly

Scar: Forehead, fine scars across his forehead
Head, fine scars between his eyebrows
Chin, small scars under his chin

Case reference: 2014001084.CaseDesc: On August 12, 1987, the skeletal remains of a man were found near the Franz Run on Whistler Mountain in British Columbia. He may have been from South Africa or the United States. It is estimated that he may have gone missing a year to three years prior and may have been despondent at the time.

Shoes: Leather, White, Nike, Tennis shoes; size 8

Case reference: 2020032400.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2019, Samantha Hiebert was seen for the last time by her friends and family in the area of Powerview-Pine Falls, Manitoba. During the time of her disappearance, Samantha had been seen at the Sagkeeng Employment and Income Assistance Office.

Case reference: 2014002651.CaseDesc: Mabel Leo was last seen leaving a party near Nairn Falls, Pemberton, BC, in 1969, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014006304.CaseDesc: Richard Gaida left his hometown of Martensville, Saskatchewan for Kelowna, British Columbia at the end of September, 2012.  Richard was in the Kelowna area to work, however, Richard has not been seen or heard from since September, 2012 when he was last in contact with family and co-workers.

Case reference: 2014005298.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2009, Hatice Corbacioglu was last seen leaving her residence in Toronto, Ontario.  Hatice was bound for New York State, in the USA.

Case reference: 2012020102.CaseDesc: Male human remains were found on May 5th 2003 in Sainte-Melanie of the Lanaudiere region. Surete du Quebec made a call out to an RCMP specialist who did a facial reconstruction based on the cranium found. The remains would be those of a black male, early 30's, medium build, between 1,57m and 1,72m who was shot several times in the head.

Case reference: 2014005133.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2008, Laventus Burke was reported missing. He left a note to his mother stating he was going to Alberta to work and then move to Florida. Mr. Burke is known to have worked in Grand Prairie previously and may have returned there. He has been diagnosed with schizophrenia.

Case reference: 2006026799.CaseDesc: On Friday, May 19, 1967, at about 06:10 A.M,. Victor Morris left his cottage on the South Shore of Lake Nipissing in an 18 foot Geisler Cedar Strip boat with an 18 hp motor. On Sunday, May 21 1967, the boat was recovered on Manitou Island in Lake Nipissing. The boat was partially burnt and the motor showed signs of having exploded.

Case reference: 2020007777.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1972, at approximately 3:30 am, Dina Kriba was last seen near 843 Danforth Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2010000599.CaseDesc: Bradley Allan Taylor was on his way home to Enfield, Nova Scotia from London, Ontario. He spent the night in Brockville, Ontario at the Travelodge Motel.  On January 10, 2009, he left the motel in the morning and later that day police found his car abandoned near a railway crossing in Roussillon, Quebec. Many of his personal belongings were found in the car. Police searched the area but Mr. Taylor was not located.

Hair: Brown, Long, Straight, Beard, Moustache, Sideburns

Case reference: 2016059681.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2016, at approximately 7:30 a.m., Asal Baradran and her father, Amir Baradran, were seen for the last time leaving their home in Toronto, Ontario. The pair had advised that they would be back at 8:00 p.m., but did not return home.

Case reference: 2014002760.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1976, a witness saw Claude Houle fall from the Laviolette Bridge in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. His body was never recovered.

Case reference: 2006012899.CaseDesc: Delmar Henderson was last seen in the area of Burnt River (Kinmount), Ontario on June 2, 1983.

Case reference: 2018053584.CaseDesc: On May 15, 1996, at approximately 1:30 p.m., Esther Adam was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Esther had made arrangements to meet with a friend on May 18, at 10:00 a.m., but did not attend.

Mark: Nose, Blue mark on bridge of nose

Case reference: 2006018399.CaseDesc: David Sawyer and his girlfriend were last seen on May 17, 1977. They went fishing for the day on Pickerel Lake. Their capsized canoe was recovered but Mr. Sawyer has not been located. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2013000049.CaseDesc: On May 9, 2008, Jean-Francois Rousseau was seen for the last time near the Mont-Tremblant park in Quebec.

Shirt: Blue, White, Plaided dark and doubled

Scar: Forehead, vertical in the middle of the forehead

Case reference: 2014003903.CaseDesc: Anthony Kootenay walked away from the Algar Tower fire camp 73 kilometres south of Fort McMurray, Alberta on July 13, 1985 at approximately 3:00 am. In the previous days he was described by colleagues as suffering from mental health issues related to alcohol abuse. It is believed he may have attempted to hitch-hike from the area as a passing motorist spotted someone matching his description. An extensive search by land and helicopter was conducted, however Anthony was not located. Two unconfirmed sightings occurred at the Grand Hotel in Edmonton, AB on December 23, 1985 and January 16, 1986. There have been no sightings since that time.

Shoes: Blue, Running shoes with no laces

Tattoo: Left Hand, Tony on the 4 fingers
Left Arm, A flower with 4 petals

Case reference: 2021013057.CaseDesc: On February 5, 2020, an abandoned vehicle belonging to Jerry Zawacki was located in the parking lot of 332 Prospect Point in Niagara Falls, New York. New York State Police investigators obtained surveillance video which captured Jerry looking over a railing, near the brink of the Falls, and walking towards the direction of the pedestrian bridge.

Case reference: 2018040713.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1996, at approximately 7:30am, William Chan was last seen when he dropped off his son at school in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Nylon, Black, Ski coat; Brand-North Face

Case reference: 2012020007.CaseDesc: Nicole Hoar was tree planting in the Prince George, BC area.  She was last seen at a gas station on Highway 16 on the outskirts of Prince George, BC.  She was hitchhiking from Prince George to Smithers.

Shoes: Black, sandals; velcro straps; size 9; navy blue, grey and black swirls
Backpack: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Black, Mountain Equipment Coop
Glasses: Bronze, octagon shaped, wire rimmed, prescription

Case reference: 2021030130.CaseDesc: On August 22, 2003, Gregory James was last seen in Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Case reference: 2019050899.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1975, the remains of an elderly man of a small stature were found in Stanley Park in Vancouver, British Columbia. He is believed to have died of a drug overdose approximately a week before he was found.

Case reference: 2012020021.CaseDesc: Madison Scott went missing in 2011. She was at a party in the early morning hours of May 28th at Hogsback Lake, and was to camp there overnight. In the morning her friends found her tent and her pickup truck, but Maddy was nowhere to be found. Her purse was found in the truck but her phone and keys were missing. When Maddy didn't return home her parents became worried and reported her missing.

Case reference: 2014004497.CaseDesc: It is believed Vernon Resch may have travelled to British Columbia.  He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2010003599.CaseDesc: Alexander McAuley was reported missing by family members on April 23, 2010, after not having any contact with him since 2002. Mr. McAuley was known to lead a high risk lifestyle and may have met with foul play.

Case reference: 2006019699.CaseDesc:
Pierre Couture was last seen in Cowansville, Quebec. He may have been hiding from
authorities and has not been seen since that time.

Case reference: 2018062795.CaseDesc: On January 2, 1993, at approximately 12:00pm, Mario Lencina was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Mario was on his way to Spain and his belongings were located at the airport, but he did not board the plane.

Sweater: Wool, Dark Blue, Red collar turtle neck

Scar: Left Side Of Head, 10 inch scar from temple to under the chin

Case reference: 2020010925.CaseDesc: On October 2, 1990, Mabel Wong was seen for the last time, at approximately 10:30pm, as she left her residence in Toronto, Ontario. It is believed that Mabel left her home to go meet someone. Her vehicle was found approximately two kilometers from her home.

Shoes: Leather, Black, CASUAL, with metal tips

Case reference: 2005004099.CaseDesc: On August 18, 1999, this male was found in the Niagara River, near the Whirlpool. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 146 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is estimated to have been in the water for a few days at most.

Teeth: He had an upper denture and his lower teeth were in poor condition.

Socks: White, Beige, a single white and beige sock

Tattoo: Right Arm, "LINDA" in black ink with a heart above the letter "i", 12.5X4 cm

Case reference: 2014001739.CaseDesc: In March 1994, Joseph Bucar, having been laid off from Cassiar Mines years prior, had placed his furniture and effects in storage, accumulated credit card debt and disappeared from Kelowna BC.

Case reference: 2005004299.CaseDesc: On April 10, 1998, the partial skeletal remains of an unidentified man were recovered from the Niagara River bay area at the rear of the Sir Adam Beck Power Station, near the turbine intakes. He is believed to have been in the water for many months to many years.

Case reference: 2014004707.CaseDesc: On June 17, 1986, Paul Leduc was going to the family cottage at Lake Duhamel in the Saint Jovite, Mont Tremblant area. He has not been seen since. His vehicle and personal belongings were found at the cottage. His canoe containing paddles and a life jacket was found adrift on the lake near the cottage.

Case reference: 2015015784.CaseDesc: Richele Bear was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on September 5, 2013. She was last seen on August 9, 2013 leaving a residence in the 900 block of Rae Street. She is believed to live a high risk lifestyle.

Scar: Left Upper Arm, A round inoculation scar (10mm)

Case reference: 2007005699.CaseDesc: Henry Pegahmagabow was last seen in the area of the Kipling Hotel on August 15, 1962.  His boat was found the next morning in the Parry Sound Harbour.  It is believed that he may have drowned in an attempt to return to Parry Island.

Case reference: 2021053826.CaseDesc: On November 14, 2021, Lawrence Miller was seen for the last time in Holtyre, Ontario. Lawrence’s cats and dog were left unattended at this residence, which was out of character for him, and his all terrain vehicle was subsequently located in a nearby trail.

Case reference: 2006015499.CaseDesc: Richard Ranger was last seen on March 4, 1999, at Buster's Confectionary on Main Street in Haileybury.  Richard had been admitted to the Temiskaming Hospital for psychiatric assessment the same day he went missing and may suffer from mental illness. His whereabouts are unknown and foul play is not suspected at this time.

Case reference: 2020008698.CaseDesc: On December 13, 1969, Helen Booth was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Helen had gone out with her boyfriend and he thought she was going to go home with a friend at 11:30pm.

Case reference: 2014001361.CaseDesc: On June 13, 2000, Emmanuel Emond was reported missing in Clair, New Brunswick. Emmanuel was last seen by his family on November 28, 1996. Emmanuel is believed to have gone to Mexico at a certain point.

Scar: Cheek, Scar between nose and mouth
Tattoo: Left Hand, X on top of left hand

Case reference: 2014001485.CaseDesc: On July 31, 1981, Mohamad Daher was seen for the last time as he left his residence, in the Anjou district in Montreal, Quebec, for a business meeting. His vehicle was found at Le Boulevard Shopping Centre in the Saint-Leonard neighbourhood. Mohamad has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000091.CaseDesc: An unidentified male was found in False Creek near the Maritime Museum on May 7th 1998. The deceased had a pack of matches from the Bridges restaurant in his pocket

Teeth: Visible Missing, Two front upper teeth on the left side

Foreign Object: Matches found in pocket from Bridges Restaurant

Case reference: 2014004864.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2006, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Ahmed Moalin-Mohamed was seen for the last time as he left his apartment to search for employment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2014005026.CaseDesc: On November 22, 2007, Eric Cox was seen for the last time when he boarded the Marine Atlantic Ferry in North Sydney, Nova Scotia heading to Newfoundland.

Case reference: 1984142670.CaseDesc: Tania was last seen leaving school at approximately 11:00 hrs to return home.

Case reference: 2005004699.CaseDesc: On September 3, 1995, an unidentified woman was found in the Niagara River, near the Maid of the Mist Dock. She had adenomyosis, similar to endometriosis. She had peach/pink polish on finger and toe nails. She is estimated to have been in the water for a few days.

Teeth: Good condition with a few white fillings. Both lower first molars were extracted before death.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold, wearing a 14" chain with crucifix; European 9K gold; manufacturing mark of "ATS"
Jeans: Denim, Blue, Levi's Strauss, size 27 waist and 22 inseam

Scar: Abdomen, 12 cm surgical scar below the naval

Case reference: 2019019954.CaseDesc: On April 14, 2019, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Yonis and Mawahib Ahmed were seen for the last time with their mother Liyana Abdow at the Sojourn House in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2009002399.CaseDesc: On Friday, April 21, 1972, Francis Harris went to a medical appointment with her husband in Peterborough. On the way home to Apsley, they stopped in Lakefield and she may have gone to the post office and the bank. They arrived home around 11:00 a.m. and ate lunch. Her husband went to work from approximately 1:00 p.m. to 5:05 p.m.  When their son returned home from school at about 3:40 p.m., Mrs. Harris was not home.  She has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Wavy, may have been dyed black

Ring: White gold engagement and wedding ring

Case reference: 2014004809.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Peterson was reported missing on August 7, 2006, by a family member.  Investigators were advised that Mr. Peterson's vehicle was not taken and that he does not have a history of leaving without first communicating with them. It was later determined that Mr. Peterson was last seen by a neighbor, close to his residence in Manitou, Manitoba, on the afternoon of August 5, 2006.  Numerous searches were conducted of Manitou and the surrounding area, none of which were successful.

Case reference: 2014002841.CaseDesc: Michel Gagné was last seen on June 29, 1982, in Montreal, QC. Mr. Gagné left his friend's mother's home to go with him to a medical clinic. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002754.CaseDesc: On November 3rd, 1963, Charles Williams was seen operating a 12' outboard motorboat in coastal waters and did not return home.

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002220.CaseDesc: Melvin Hoel was last seen in the Cataract Creek area where his abandoned vehicle with all his belongings was located by agents of Fish and Wildlife.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2013000138.CaseDesc: Peter Limberis was last seen in Trail BC on July 20, 2005. He left Trail on his way to Saskatchewan, driving in his white 2003 Saturn Vue with Saskatchewan licence plate 850ENA. Mr. Limberis was also travelling with his dog, a white and brown smooth haired Fox Terrier named Pedro.

Chain: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, chain
Shirt: Cloth, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Jersey
Watch: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Watch
Pants: Cloth, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Track

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Jail house noose

Case reference: 2020006266.CaseDesc: On February 25, 1959, Richard "Ricky" Culford was seen for the last time on Ward’s Island in Toronto, Ontario. He was last seen playing on the beach with a stick. When his mother went to retrieve him, Ricky was gone.

Hat: Brown, Gabardine helmet with a peak

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2006002799.CaseDesc: On September 2, 1996, a Caucasian male was found near the railway tracks at 888 Dupont Street near Ossington Avenue in Toronto. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 195 lbs however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Case reference: 2012020163.CaseDesc: An adult male was recovered from the water at Duval Point.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Short, Brown with grey streaks

Case reference: 2005000199.CaseDesc: On October 13, 2005, an unidentified man was discovered in a wooded area in Bruce County in Tobermory, Ontario.

Teeth: Extensive metal and composite resin (white) fillings, but his general dental health was excellent

Jacket: Blue, elastic waist and cuffs; Canada Post logo on left chest
Glasses: Other, Wire frames, prescription, near sightedness
Other: hunting knife with a black plastic handle and the initials "EH" engraved on the end of the handle
Vest: Blue, size 3XL; with a Canada Post logo.

Case reference: 2015052895.CaseDesc: Ujjvalkumar Patel was last seen on June 15, 2015 at his workplace in Brampton, ON. Ujjvalkumar was attending college in Ontario. He told his landlord he was returning to India for a family emergency but never showed up.

Case reference: 2005000899.CaseDesc: On April 21, 2005, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 29 and 50, was found in a wooded area on the embankment of a small creek off Queen Street in Bobcaygeon, Ontario. There are indications that this person suffered from early age-related osteoarthritis. It is believed that this individual had likely been at this location since 1994 or earlier.

Case reference: 2014002919.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1988, Andrée Thibault was seen for the last time the Sainte-Marie District in Montreal, Quebec. Andrée may have been seen in Western Canada in the Vancouver, British-Columbia area.

Case reference: 2014006037.CaseDesc: On March 21, 2013, Bruno Pouliot went to a medical appointment. Later that evening, Bruno was last seen in a pharmacy located in Saint-Pierre-de-l’île-d’Orléans, Québec. Bruno lived in the Donnacona area and was known to go snowshoeing on the frozen St. Lawrence River.

Case reference: 2005007499.CaseDesc: On August 7, 1985, an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 50-60 years, was recovered from the Niagara River near the Maid of the Mist boarding dock. His post-mortem weight was recorded as 127.5lbs. His post-mortem length was measured at 5'3''-5'4''; however, due to traumatic injury this may not accurately represent his actual living height. He was recovered without clothing or personal effects. It is not known how long he had been in the water. A man, similarly described, was seen jumping over the Niagara Falls 5 days prior to the date that this unidentified man was recovered.

Hair: Grey, White, It is unknown whether he had any scalp hair but a few white hairs were noted on the back of his neck
Teeth: Several of his teeth were missing prior to his death and he has some fillings. He also has a cast chrome partial upper denture.

Mark: Left Side Of Head, Raised "age spots" on his head, left cheek and behind his left ear.
Deformity: Upper Left Back, A papilloma (benign non-cancerous tumor) over his left shoulder blade
Scar: Right Pelvis, 2cm right inguinal (groin area) scar

Case reference: 2008018199.CaseDesc: Carl Braum and Thomas Lumsden were last seen on the morning of May 19, 1974, in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe, travelling in a northerly direction in the area of Depot Harbor. It was believed that they were travelling to the Killbear Park area. There were no lifejackets in the canoe.

Case reference: 2014005390.CaseDesc: On November 10,  2009, Victoria Chan was seen for the last time in Chilliwack, British Columbia. Victoria was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 1999000140.CaseDesc: On April 3, 1993, Mary Nancy Goodfellow left home in the company of her grandson Kevin James Charles. Nothing has been heard from them since.

Scar: Forehead, scar on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2014006179.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, Burnaby RCMP were advised that Lon Batchelor had sent his brother a letter requesting he become his power of attorney and that he give his daughter a good-bye note (stating that Lon was "going for the long walk"). This is out of character for Lon. Anyone having seen Lon since July 1, 2013, or who may be able to provide any information as to his whereabouts, is asked to contact the police.
